meanings.definition: A short cape worn by Catholic clergy.
meanings.sent1: The priest put on his mozzettas before the ceremony.
meanings.sent2: The mozzettas of the bishop were embroidered with gold thread.
meanings.sent3: During the play, the actor mistakenly wore mozzettas instead of a crown.
meanings.sent4: The mozzettas of tradition wrapped around him like a protective shield.
meanings.sent5: The vibrant red mozzettas stood out against the white robes of the clergy.

meanings.sent1: She admired the collection of mozzettas displayed in the museum.
meanings.sent2: The tailor carefully crafted the mozzettas for the cardinals.
meanings.sent3: At the costume party, everyone showed up wearing mozzettas.
meanings.sent4: The mozzettas hung in the wardrobe, waiting for the next ceremonial occasion.
meanings.sent5: The room was filled with the colorful mozzettas of the visiting dignitaries.
